Abstract: Photochemical upconversion via triplet-triplet annihilation (TTA) has garnered significant attention due to its potential applications in solar energy harvesting and bioimaging. This review explores recent advancements in TTA-based upconversion systems, focusing on the interplay between sensitizer-chromophore pairs, kinetics, and magnetic field effects. We discuss strategies to overcome the spin statistical limit and enhance upconversion quantum yields. The influence of molecular design on TTA efficiency is examined, highlighting the importance of optimizing energy transfer processes. Additionally, we analyze the impact of external magnetic fields on upconversion performance and investigate novel approaches to manipulate spin dynamics. This comprehensive overview provides insights into the fundamental principles governing TTA-based upconversion and identifies promising directions for future research and practical applications.
